name: Psychotrope Thallid
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a spore counter on Psychotrope Thallid.
Remove three spore counters from Psychotrope Thallid: Create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token.
{1}, Sacrifice a Saproling: Draw a card.

name: Pteron Ghost
text:
Flying
Sacrifice Pteron Ghost: Regenerate target artifact.

editions.flavor: Defending to the death isn't always enough.

name: Public Execution
text: Destroy target creature an opponent controls. Each other creature that player controls gets -2/-0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Though the executioner did not speak, the villagers got the message.
Though the executioner did not speak, the villagers got the message.

name: Puca's Mischief
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may exchange control of target nonland permanent you control and target nonland permanent an opponent controls with an equal or lesser converted mana cost.

name: Puffer Extract
text: {X}, {T}: Target creature you control gets +X/+X until end of turn. Destroy it at the beginning of the next end step.

editions.flavor: The puffer's flesh is the deadliest in the sea—and therefore the most useful.

name: Pull from Eternity
text: Put target face-up exiled card into its owner's graveyard.

editions.flavor:
It is best to conquer dragons before they hatch.
—Femeref adage

name: Pull from the Deep
text: Return up to one target instant card and up to one target sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand. Exile Pull from the Deep.

editions.flavor: Ideas, not stones, form the true foundation of Meletis.

name: Pulling Teeth
text: Clash with an opponent. If you win, target player discards two cards. Otherwise, that player discards a card. (Each clashing player reveals the top card of his or her library, then puts that card on the top or bottom. A player wins if his or her card had a higher converted mana cost.)

name: Pull Under
text: Target creature gets -5/-5 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Although nowhere on Kamigawa was safe during the war, the Takenuma Swamp was the most horrifying. The rotting bamboo itself rebelled against its mortal inhabitants, pulling them into unmarked graves."
—Observations of the Kami War

name: Pulmonic Sliver
text:
All Sliver creatures have flying.
All Slivers have "If this permanent would be put into a graveyard, you may put it on top of its owner's library instead."

editions.flavor: Like a great bellows it hisses, and its kin, both living and dead, are lifted to safety.

name: Pulsating Illusion
text:
Flying
Discard a card: Pulsating Illusion gets +4/+4 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.

name: Pulsemage Advocate
text: {T}: Return three target cards from an opponent's graveyard to his or her hand. Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.

editions.flavor: "Our unity revives our hopes."

name: Pulse of Llanowar
text: If a basic land you control is tapped for mana, it produces mana of a color of your choice instead of any other type.

editions.flavor:
"Gaea's memory is eternal, and she exists in all things."
—Molimo, maro-sorcerer

name: Pulse of Murasa
text: Return target creature or land card from a graveyard to its owner's hand. You gain 6 life.

editions.flavor: "Little flower twirl and bloom, arise from this your rocky tomb. Little warrior slash and brawl, be born again to free us all."

name: Pulse of the Dross
text: Target player reveals three cards from his or her hand and you choose one of them. That player discards that card. Then if that player has more cards in hand than you, return Pulse of the Dross to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: Before tyrants or torturers, there was evil.

name: Pulse of the Fields
text: You gain 4 life. Then if an opponent has more life than you, return Pulse of the Fields to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: Before religion or civilization, there was order.

name: Pulse of the Forge
text: Pulse of the Forge deals 4 damage to target player. Then if that player has more life than you, return Pulse of the Forge to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: Before wars or weapons, there was anger.

name: Pulse of the Grid
text: Draw two cards, then discard a card. Then if an opponent has more cards in hand than you, return Pulse of the Grid to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: Before labs or lectures, there was insight.

name: Pulse of the Tangle
text: Create a 3/3 green Beast creature token. Then if an opponent controls more creatures than you, return Pulse of the Tangle to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: Before predators or prey, there was life.

name: Pulse Tracker
text: Whenever Pulse Tracker attacks, each opponent loses 1 life.

editions.flavor:
"You can't think your way out of this, Jace. Thought implies life, and life requires a pulse—music to a hunter's ears."
—Vraska
Pulse trackers terrorize adventurers, driving them through the jungle toward certain death at the gates of Malakir.

name: Pulverize
text:
You may sacrifice two Mountains rather than pay Pulverize's mana cost.
Destroy all artifacts.

name: Punctuate
text: Punctuate deals damage to target creature equal to half the number of punctuation marks in that creature's text box. (The punctuation marks are  ? , ; : - ( ) / " ' & .)

editions.flavor: "Ooh—right in the colon."

name: Puncture Blast
text:
Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)
Puncture Blast deals 3 damage to target creature or player.

editions.flavor: Gnarltrunk didn't remember having quite that many knotholes.

name: Puncture Bolt
text: Puncture Bolt deals 1 damage to target creature. Put a -1/-1 counter on that creature.

editions.flavor: Cinder pyromancers measure their success by counting their enemies' smoking holes.

name: Puncturing Light
text: Destroy target attacking or blocking creature with power 3 or less.

editions.flavor: "If you refuse to see the light, then you will feel it."

"The vampires knew what was coming. I know it. And they did nothing. They deserve to feel the same agony they've caused all of us."
—Anitan, Ondu cleric

name: Punish Ignorance
text: Counter target spell. Its controller loses 3 life and you gain 3 life.

editions.flavor:
"Amateurish. Nearsighted. A waste of my time and everyone else's."
—Indra, nullmage of Vectis

name: Punishing Fire
text:
Punishing Fire deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
Whenever an opponent gains life, you may pay {R}. If you do, return Punishing Fire from your graveyard to your hand.

name: Punishment
text: Destroy each artifact, creature, and enchantment with converted mana cost X.

name: Punish the Enemy
text: Punish the Enemy deals 3 damage to target player and 3 damage to target creature.

editions.flavor:
"When justice descends, the servant will burn with the master."
—Aurelia

name: Puppet Conjurer
text:
{U}, {T}: Create a 0/1 blue Homunculus artifact creature token.
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a Homunculus.

editions.flavor: He scowls at his imperfect creation, then crushes it to scrap. He salvages the etherium and begins anew.

name: Puppeteer
text: {U}, {T}: You may tap or untap target creature.

editions.flavor: "Getting people to do what you want is merely a matter of telling them what they want to hear."
"Getting people to do what you want is merely a matter of telling them what they want to hear."
"Getting people to do what you want is merely a matter of telling them what they want to hear."

"That's the funny thing about free will. You don't feel any different without it."
—Ambassador Laquatus

name: Puppeteer Clique
text:
Flying
When Puppeteer Clique enters the battlefield, put target creature card from an opponent's graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. It gains haste. At the beginning of your next end step, exile it.
Persist (When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)

name: Puppet Master
text:
Enchant creature
When enchanted creature dies, return that card to its owner's hand. If that card is returned to its owner's hand this way, you may pay {U}{U}{U}. If you do, return Puppet Master to its owner's hand.

name: Puppet Strings
text: {2}, {T}: You may tap or untap target creature.

editions.flavor: "Have no illusions," Volrath warned Greven, "about free will."

editions.set: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
editions.flavor: "Have no illusions," Volrath warned Greven, "about free will."

name: Puppet's Verdict
text: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, destroy all creatures with power 2 or less. If you lose the flip, destroy all creatures with power 3 or greater.

editions.flavor:
"What was heads again?"
—Mercadian magistrate

name: Pure
text: Destroy target multicolored permanent.

name: Pure Intentions
text:
Whenever a spell or ability an opponent controls causes you to discard cards this turn, return those cards from your graveyard to your hand.
When a spell or ability an opponent controls causes you to discard Pure Intentions, return Pure Intentions from your graveyard to your hand at the beginning of the next end step.

name: Purelace
text: Target spell or permanent becomes white. (Mana symbols on that permanent remain unchanged.)

name: Pure Reflection
text: Whenever a player casts a creature spell, destroy all Reflections. Then that player creates an X/X white Reflection creature token, where X is the converted mana cost of that spell.

name: Puresight Merrow
text: {W/U}, {Q}: Look at the top card of your library. You may exile that card. ({Q} is the untap symbol.)

editions.flavor: Stripped of his sight, he was free to see only the ideal.

name: Puresteel Paladin
text:
Whenever an Equipment enters the battlefield under your control, you may draw a card.
Metalcraft — Equipment you control have equip {0} as long as you control three or more artifacts.

name: Purgatory
text:
Whenever a nontoken creature is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, exile that card.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may pay {4} and 2 life. If you do, return a card exiled with Purgatory to the battlefield.

name: Purge
text: Destroy target artifact creature or black creature. It can't be regenerated.

editions.flavor: For the first and last time, the horrific creature experienced terror.

name: Purge the Profane
text: Target opponent discards two cards and you gain 2 life.

editions.flavor: The Orzhov hear the plans of the other guilds through the guilty thoughts of the disloyal.

name: Purging Scythe
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, Purging Scythe deals 2 damage to the creature with the least toughness. If two or more creatures are tied for least toughness, you choose one of them.

name: Purify
text: Destroy all artifacts and enchantments.

editions.flavor:
"Our Mother! The sky was Her hair; the sun, Her face. She danced on the grass and in the hills."
—Song of All, canto 23

"We have no need for these trinkets. We need only the strength of our swords and the virtue of our hearts."
—The Northern Paladin

name: Purify the Grave
text:
Exile target card from a graveyard.
Flashback {W} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

editions.flavor: Some priests speak in whispers of the Helvault, a silver prison of unpurged evils.

name: Purity
text:
Flying
If noncombat damage would be dealt to you, prevent that damage. You gain life equal to the damage prevented this way.
When Purity is put into a graveyard from anywhere, shuffle it into its owner's library.

name: Purphoros, God of the Forge
text:
Indestructible
As long as your devotion to red is less than five, Purphoros isn't a creature.
Whenever another creature enters the battlefield under your control, Purphoros deals 2 damage to each opponent.
{2}{R}: Creatures you control get +1/+0 until end of turn.

name: Purphoros's Emissary
text:
Bestow {6}{R} (If you cast this card for its bestow cost, it's an Aura spell with enchant creature. It becomes a creature again if it's not attached to a creature.)
Menace (This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3 and has menace.

name: Purraj of Urborg
text:
Purraj of Urborg has first strike as long as it's attacking.
Whenever a player casts a black spell, you may pay {B}. If you do, put a +1/+1 counter on Purraj of Urborg.

name: Pursuit of Flight
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has "{U}: This creature gains flying until end of turn."

editions.flavor:
"Watch the voltage. We don't need another charred, crashing viashino."
—Bori Andon, Izzet blastseeker

name: Pursuit of Knowledge
text:
If you would draw a card, you may put a study counter on Pursuit of Knowledge instead.
Remove three study counters from Pursuit of Knowledge, Sacrifice Pursuit of Knowledge: Draw seven cards.

name: Pus Kami
text:
{B}, Sacrifice Pus Kami: Destroy target nonblack creature.
Soulshift 6 (When this creature dies, you may return target Spirit card with converted mana cost 6 or less from your graveyard to your hand.)

name: Put Away
text: Counter target spell. You may shuffle up to one target card from your graveyard into your library.

editions.flavor: Kithkin spellbottlers spend half their time preserving old memories and the other half punishing the new.

name: Putrefaction
text: Whenever a player casts a green or white spell, that player discards a card.

editions.flavor:
"Do you want to be alive or whole?"
—Ta-Karnst, Cho-Arrim healer

name: Putrefax
text:
Trample, haste
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
At the beginning of the end step, sacrifice Putrefax.

name: Putrefy
text: Destroy target artifact or creature. It can't be regenerated.

editions.flavor:
"We are all decaying, always in a state of near-death. One moment without breath and we begin to break down."
—Cevraya, Golgari shaman

"All matter, animate or not, rots when exposed to time. We merely speed up the process."
—Ezoc, Golgari rot farmer

"All matter, animate or not, rots when exposed to time. We merely speed up the process."
—Ezoc, Golgari rot farmer
"We are all decaying, always in a state of near-death. One moment without breath and we begin to break down."—Cevraya, Golgari shaman

"We are all decaying, always in a state of near-death. One moment without breath and we begin to break down."
—Cevraya, Golgari shaman

name: Putrid Cyclops
text: When Putrid Cyclops enters the battlefield, scry 1, then reveal the top card of your library. Putrid Cyclops gets -X/-X until end of turn, where X is that card's converted mana cost. (To scry 1, look at the top card of your library, then you may put that card on the bottom of your library.)

name: Putrid Imp
text:
Discard a card: Putrid Imp gains flying until end of turn.
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Putrid Imp gets +1/+1 and can't block.

name: Putrid Leech
text: Pay 2 life: Putrid Leech gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.

editions.flavor: It reacted to Naya's overabundant food supply by growing additional mouths.

"The Golgari would say that life comes from death and death comes from life. But sometimes, death comes from the dead."
—Vraska
It reacted to Naya's overabundant food supply by growing additional mouths.

name: Putrid Raptor
text: Morph—Discard a Zombie card. (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

editions.flavor: It eagerly gobbles up bits of its own rotting flesh as they fall to the swampy ground.

name: Putrid Warrior
text:
Whenever Putrid Warrior deals damage, choose one —
• Each player loses 1 life.
• Each player gains 1 life.

editions.flavor: "I do not like it," said Grizzlegom, "but I will take every soldier I can get."

name: Pygmy Allosaurus
text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)

editions.flavor:
"I don't understand the appeal of keeping these things as pets, unless you want your children eaten."
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox

name: Pygmy Giant
text: {R}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Pygmy Giant deals X damage to target creature, where X is a number in the sacrificed creature's text box.

editions.flavor:
"487. You're welcome."
—Bucky, flavor text writer

name: Pygmy Hippo
text: Whenever Pygmy Hippo attacks and isn't blocked, you may have defending player activate a mana ability of each land he or she controls and empty his or her mana pool. If you do, Pygmy Hippo assigns no combat damage this turn and at the beginning of your next main phase this turn, you add an amount of {C} to your mana pool equal to the amount of mana emptied from that player's mana pool this way.

name: Pygmy Kavu
text: When Pygmy Kavu enters the battlefield, draw a card for each black creature your opponents control.

editions.flavor:
"We could learn a lot by watching the little ones," said Agnate.
"Define ‘little,'" replied Grizzlegom.

name: Pygmy Pyrosaur
text:
Pygmy Pyrosaur can't block.
{R}: Pygmy Pyrosaur gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
Do not judge a lizard by its size.
—Ghitu proverb

Do not judge a lizard by its size.
—Ghitu proverb

Do not judge a lizard by its size.
—Ghitu proverb

name: Pygmy Razorback
text: Trample

editions.flavor: As a rite of passage, Kipamu youths taunt razorbacks with long sticks . . . then flee.

name: Pygmy Troll
text:
Whenever Pygmy Troll becomes blocked by a creature, Pygmy Troll gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
{G}: Regenerate Pygmy Troll.

editions.flavor: "Who you callin' ‘shorty'?"

name: Pyknite
text: When Pyknite enters the battlefield, draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

editions.flavor:
"Never cross a Pyknite, if you value your scalp."
—Lovisa Coldeyes,
Balduvian Chieftain

name: Pyramids
text:
{2}: Choose one —
• Destroy target Aura attached to a land.
• The next time target land would be destroyed this turn, remove all damage marked on it instead.

name: Pyre Charger
text:
Haste
{R}: Pyre Charger gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

editions.set: Duel Decks Anthology, Jace vs. Chandra
editions.flavor: His blade was forged over coals of moaning treefolk, curved at the optimum angle for severing heads, and heated to volcanic temperatures by his touch.
His blade was forged over coals of moaning treefolk, curved at the optimum angle for severing heads, and heated to volcanic temperatures by his touch.
His blade was forged over coals of moaning treefolk, curved at the optimum angle for severing heads, and heated to volcanic temperatures by his touch.

name: Pyreheart Wolf
text:
Whenever Pyreheart Wolf attacks, creatures you control gain menace until end of turn. (They can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
Undying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)

name: Pyre Hound
text:
Trample
Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, put a +1/+1 counter on Pyre Hound.

editions.flavor: Its growl is the crackling and popping of a wildfire untamed.

name: Pyretic Hunter
text:
Reveal Pyretic Hunter as you draft it and note how many cards you've drafted this draft round, including Pyretic Hunter.
Menace (This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
Pyretic Hunter enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it, where X is the highest number you noted for cards named Pyretic Hunter.

name: Pyretic Ritual
text: Add {R}{R}{R} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: The Multiverse is filled with limitless power just waiting for someone to reach out and seize it.

name: Pyrewild Shaman
text:
Bloodrush — {1}{R}, Discard Pyrewild Shaman: Target attacking creature gets +3/+1 until end of turn.
Whenever one or more creatures you control deal combat damage to a player, if Pyrewild Shaman is in your graveyard, you may pay {3}. If you do, return Pyrewild Shaman to your hand.

name: Pyre Zombie
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, if Pyre Zombie is in your graveyard, you may pay {1}{B}{B}. If you do, return Pyre Zombie to your hand.
{1}{R}{R}, Sacrifice Pyre Zombie: Pyre Zombie deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

name: Pyric Salamander
text: {R}: Pyric Salamander gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Sacrifice Pyric Salamander at the beginning of the next end step.

editions.flavor:
When you've been chased by a dragon, you run from every lizard.
—Suq'Ata saying

name: Pyrite Spellbomb
text:
{R}, Sacrifice Pyrite Spellbomb: Pyrite Spellbomb deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
{1}, Sacrifice Pyrite Spellbomb: Draw a card.

editions.flavor:
"Melt that which was never frozen."
—Spellbomb inscription

"Melt that which was never frozen."
—Spellbomb inscription

name: Pyroblast
text:
Choose one —
• Counter target spell if it's blue.
• Destroy target permanent if it's blue.

editions.flavor:
"Just the thing for those pesky water mages."
—Jaya Ballard, task mage

"Just the thing for those pesky water mages."
—Jaya Ballard, task mage

text: Pyroclasm deals 2 damage to each creature.

"Leaves more room for the big ones to fight in, you know."

name: Pyroclast Consul
text: Kinship — At the beginning of your upkeep, you may look at the top card of your library. If it shares a creature type with Pyroclast Consul, you may reveal it. If you do, Pyroclast Consul deals 2 damage to each creature.

name: Pyroconvergence
text: Whenever you cast a multicolored spell, Pyroconvergence deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

editions.flavor:
"The Izzet are an equation that turns lunacy into explosions."
—Leonos, Azorius arbiter

name: Pyrohemia
text:
At the beginning of the end step, if no creatures are on the battlefield, sacrifice Pyrohemia.
{R}: Pyrohemia deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.

name: Pyrokinesis
text:
You may exile a red card from your hand rather than pay Pyrokinesis's mana cost.
Pyrokinesis deals 4 damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures.

editions.flavor:
"Anybody want some . . . toast?"
—Jaya Ballard, task mage

"Anybody want some . . . toast?"
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

name: Pyromancer Ascension
text:
Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell that has the same name as a card in your graveyard, you may put a quest counter on Pyromancer Ascension.
Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell while Pyromancer Ascension has two or more quest counters on it, you may copy that spell. You may choose new targets for the copy.

name: Pyromancer's Assault
text: Whenever you cast your second spell each turn, Pyromancer's Assault deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

editions.flavor: Never ask a pyromancer if that's the best she's got.

name: Pyromancer's Gauntlet
text: If a red instant or sorcery spell you control or a red planeswalker you control would deal damage to a permanent or player, it deals that much damage plus 2 to that permanent or player instead.

editions.flavor: An inferno is just a gesture away.

name: Pyromancer's Goggles
text: {T}: Add {R} to your mana pool. When that mana is spent to cast a red instant or sorcery spell, copy that spell and you may choose new targets for the copy.

editions.flavor: "I hope to meet Jaya Ballard someday. I think we'd get along."—Chandra Nalaar

name: Pyromancer's Swath
text:
If an instant or sorcery source you control would deal damage to a creature or player, it deals that much damage plus 2 to that creature or player instead.
At the beginning of each end step, discard your hand.

name: Pyromancy
text: {3}, Discard a card at random: Pyromancy deals damage to target creature or player equal to the converted mana cost of the discarded card.

editions.flavor:
Who harnesses fire controls the world.
—Ghitu proverb

name: Pyromania
text:
{1}{R}, Discard a card at random: Pyromania deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
{1}{R}, Sacrifice Pyromania: Pyromania deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

name: Pyromatics
text:
Replicate {1}{R} (When you cast this spell, copy it for each time you paid its replicate cost. You may choose new targets for the copies.)
Pyromatics deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

name: Pyrostatic Pillar
text: Whenever a player casts a spell with converted mana cost 3 or less, Pyrostatic Pillar deals 2 damage to that player.

name: Pyrotechnics
text: Pyrotechnics deals 4 damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players.

name: Pyxis of Pandemonium
text:
{T}: Each player exiles the top card of his or her library face down.
